Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Thong \Thong\, n. [OE. thong, [thorn]wong, thwang, AS. [thorn]wang; akin to Icel. [thorn]vengr a thong, latchet. [root]57. Cf. {Twinge}.] A strap of leather; especially, one used for fastening anything. [1913 Webster]
And nails for loosened spears, and thongs for shields, provide. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]
{Thong seal} (Zo["o]l.), the bearded seal. See the Note under {Seal}. [1913 Webster]
thong n 1: leather strip that forms the flexible part of a whip [syn: {lash}] 2: a thin strip of leather; often used to lash things together
